TopicTitle: made it to duna the first time, eclips question

i meant looking down on the surface of duna from orbit while the shadow of the planet is being cast on the surface. from the map screen i can see the big black shadow, but when i zoom in to my ship it dissapears.

I see. Like this?

I'm still pretty sure that it requires scatterer and if you want the shadow to be displayed pitch black like the one in my screenshot, you will also need a high orbit (at least 140km above Duna). The way the shadow is casted on the surface depends on your distance from the planet, so if you come closer, you will still recognize that it's getting darker around you (and solar panels stop working), but the shadow is no longer pitch black:

On the left side, the sunlight still reaches the surface of Duna, on right side, the sun is already blocked by Ike.

Not quiet sure though if this is configurable.
